mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, George Washington to Colonel Henry Churchill, 1759 August 9
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, George, 1732-1799
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Writing from Mount Vernon just a few months after his marriage, George Washington sends an envoy to pick up a horse purchased by his new brother-in-law, Colonel Burwell Bassett. To Henry Churchill in Fauquier County, he states, 'I was in hopes we should have had the pleasure of seeing you at Mount Vernon in yo[ur] way up - Mrs. Washington (who joins in her Compliments) impeaches you of a breach of promise in failure of this, and I don't know a better method of attonement, than coming soon and doubling the intended time of stay.' Autograph letter signed, 1 page, integral cover.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Domestic animals
